channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: リニアTVが衰退し、YouTubeやTikTokが成長する中、ハリウッドのスタジオやスポーツリーグは、10世帯のうち9世帯が購入するような優れた製品を提供する必要がある（Jason Kilar/Variety）
item.description:
Jason Kilar / Variety:
As linear TV wanes and YouTube and TikTok grow, Hollywood studios and sports leagues need to deliver a product so good that 9 out of 10 households will buy it  —  Hollywood is hurting.  The financial backbone of the industry — linear television — is rapidly shrinking as consumers continue to cut the cord at alarming rates.

item.title: 連邦司法委員会は、メディアと米下院議員38人からの要請を受け、来年に予定されているトランプ大統領の刑事裁判2件のテレビ生中継を許可できないと発表した（Josh Gerstein/Politico）
item.description:
Josh Gerstein / Politico:
A federal judicial panel says it cannot allow live TV coverage of two Trump criminal trials set for next year, after requests from media and 38 US House members  —  A courts committee says it lacks authority to modify a broadcasting ban in time for the historic criminal cases against the former president.

item.title: アマゾン第3四半期：広告収入は前年同期比26％増の120億ドル（予想104億ドル）、サブスクリプション収入は前年同期比14％増の101億ドル、北米セグメントの売上高は前年同期比11％増の879億ドル（Annie Palmer/CNBC
item.description:
Annie Palmer / CNBC:
Amazon Q3: ad revenue up 26% YoY to $12B, vs. $10.4B est., subscription revenue up 14% YoY to $10.1B, and North America segment sales up 11% YoY to $87.9B  —  - Amazon blew past analyst expectations for revenue and earnings in the third quarter.  —  Andy Jassy, CEO, Amazon

item.title: ブルームズベリー社のナイジェル・ニュートンCEOが、ジェネレーティブAIは著作権保護された作品を盗むものであり、英国の指導者たちはデジタル市場、競争、消費者法案を支持すべきであると発言（ダニエル・トーマス/フィナンシャル・タイムズ紙）
item.description:
Daniel Thomas / Financial Times:
Bloomsbury CEO Nigel Newton says generative AI steals copyrighted work and says UK leaders should support the Digital Markets, Competition, and Consumers Bill  —  Group that launched Harry Potter series says copyright not sufficiently being protected  —  The chief executive of Bloomsbury Publishing …

item.title: クリエイターはアメリカ経済のジャガーノートであるにもかかわらず、この業界は広く規制されておらず、国勢調査局の雇用指数にはほとんど登場しない（ワシントン・ポスト紙）。
item.description:
Washington Post:
Although creators are an economic juggernaut in the US, the industry remains broadly unregulated and largely fails to appear in the Census Bureau's job index  —  The U.S. Census Bureau tallies for the federal government an extensive list of 22,607 American industries, recognizing those who work …

item.title: NexstarとReachTVがNewsNationとThe CWのスポーツ番組の配信契約を発表、全米90以上の空港で50万室のホテルと2500台以上のテレビにリーチ（Mark Miller/TVNewsCheck）
item.description:
Mark Miller / TVNewsCheck:
Nexstar and ReachTV announce a distribution deal for NewsNation and The CW's sports programming, reaching 500K hotel rooms and 2,500+ TVs across 90+ US airports  —  Nexstar Media Group and ReachTV today announced that they are partnering to extend the distribution of Nexstar's cable news network NewsNation …

item.title: ノエル・クラーク対『ガーディアン』紙の名誉毀損裁判が始まる。俳優が、20人の女性の証言に基づき、自分を「性犯罪者」呼ばわりした新聞社を1000万ポンドで提訴（Tristan Kirk/London Evening Standard）
item.description:
Tristan Kirk / London Evening Standard:
The Noel Clarke vs. The Guardian libel trial begins; the actor sued the newspaper for £10M for calling him a “sexual predator”, based on testimony from 20 women  —  TV star says Guardian articles that accused him of sexual misconduct and bullying had ‘catastrophic’ impact on his career

item.title: メタ社、第3四半期の売上高は前年同期比23％増の341.5億ドル、純利益は同164％増の115.8億ドルだが、スーザン・リーCFOは第4四半期の「広告費の軟化」を警告（Hannah Murphy/Financial Times）
item.description:
Hannah Murphy / Financial Times:
Meta reports Q3 revenue up 23% YoY to $34.15B and net income up 164% YoY to $11.58B, but CFO Susan Li warns the company has observed “softer ad spend” in Q4  —  Facebook and Instagram parent says it has seen more ‘volatility’ in economic conditions

item.title: USAトゥデイの校閲スタッフは、ガネットがAIが作成したと思われる記事を掲載し、偽の傍線を使うことで自分たちを貶めていると言っているが、ガネットはこれを否定している（Will Sommer/Washington Post）。
item.description:
Will Sommer / Washington Post:
Staff at USA Today's Reviewed say Gannett is undermining them by publishing articles that appear to be AI-generated and using fake bylines, which Gannett denies  —  Staff writers at Reviewed suspect that management published stories written by AI under the names of non-existent writers.

item.title: ジェフ・ベゾス氏、ワシントン・ポスト紙にEメール：「ポスト紙の将来にコミット」し、「長期的にはポスト紙が黒字化することが重要」と考えている（Ben Mullin/@benmullin）
item.description:
Ben Mullin / @benmullin:
Jeff Bezos emails Washington Post staff: he is “committed to the future of the Post” and thinks “long term it's important that The Post return to profitability”  —  NEW: Jeff Bezos emails staff: “Long term it's important that The Post return to profitability - a key signal that we're serving readers in a way that's important to them.” [image]

item.title: Hipgnosisの株主、Blackstoneへの29の音楽カタログ売却に反対票を投じる。
item.description:
Reuters:
Hipgnosis shareholders vote against the sale of 29 music catalogs to Blackstone and require proposals to reorganize or shutter the company within six months  —  Hipgnosis Songs Fund (SONG.L) said on Thursday that shareholders voted against the sale of some music catalogues and the continuation …

item.title: Comcast、NBCU第3四半期の売上は前年同期比1％増の105.6億ドル、調整後EBITDAは19.7億ドル、Peacockは加入者数2.8億人、損失5.65億ドル、売上は前年同期比64％増の8.4億ドル（Etan Vlessing/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Etan Vlessing / The Hollywood Reporter:
Comcast reports NBCU Q3 revenue up ~1% YoY to $10.56B and a $1.97B adjusted EBITDA; Peacock had 28M subscribers, a $565M loss, and revenue up 64% YoY to $840M  —  The studio's streaming service continued to grow its customer base on a narrowed loss. … The studio's streaming service lost $614 million in the year-ago period.

item.title: CISAC：音楽、AV、演劇、文学、視覚芸術の500万人以上のクリエイターのデジタル印税は、2022年に前年比33.5％増の41.7億ユーロとなり、世界の印税の35％を占める（Stuart Dredge/Music Ally）
item.description:
Stuart Dredge / Music Ally:
CISAC: for 5M+ creators in music, AV, drama, literature, and visual arts, digital royalties rose 33.5% YoY to €4.17B in 2022, making up 35% of global royalties  —  - Click to email a link to a friend (Opens in new window)  —  Global collecting societies body Cisac has published …

item.title: 出版社ベーシック・ブックスが、ウィキペディアやブログを含む、女性経済学者に関する英国影の首相レイチェル・リーヴスの新著における明らかな盗用を認める（フィナンシャル・タイムズ紙）
item.description:
Financial Times:
Publisher Basic Books admits to apparent plagiarism in UK Shadow Chancellor's Rachel Reeves new book about women economists, including from Wikipedia and blogs  —  ‘The Women Who Made Modern Economics’ contains examples of apparent plagiarism  —  A new book by Rachel Reeves, shadow chancellor …

item.title: ABC、NYTなどの社員24人との会話から、偽情報や中傷など、イスラエルとハマスの戦争を取材することの難しさが明らかに（Brian Stelter/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Brian Stelter / The Hollywood Reporter:
Conversations with 24 employees from ABC, NYT, and other outlets reveal the challenges of covering the Israel-Hamas war, including disinformation and defamation  —  An inside look at how correspondents are juggling online harassment even as they dodge the dangers of real-time reporting in the escalating conflict.
